runs.comm: length ball outside off, angling away, left alone
short of a length, stops a touch, pushed in front of square
looks for the pull from outside off, but it is not short enough, and the bottom half of the bat sends it to mid-on
fuller, shaping in, defended to mid-off. That's the length he needs to bowl
top edge on the swivel-pull, but it doesn't carry to fine leg
wide down the leg side. Just maybe got used to bowling to the left-hand batsman
full and swinging away, driven wide of mid-off where Hassan makes a half stop. Should have done better really. Concedes an extra run
short, not much sting behind it, chest high for Warner and he pulls him away for four. Early lesson for Shapoor to not get carried away with the WACA bounce
short of a length, into the body, tucked away off the hip
on a good length, slight seam away from around off, defended from the crease
inside edge. Good length ball, seams in a touch, takes the inside edge, goes fine of the square fine leg. Dawlat Z fields this with the foot
short of a length, into the body, kisses the thigh pad on the way through, and Afsar makes a good save down the leg side
wide length ball, Finch drives hard at it, gets a thick edge that flies by point
on a length, just outside off, swings away a touch, defended to mid-on
another outswinger, just outside off, defended off the outer half of the bat
on a length, outside off, straightens a touch, defended again
fuller, almost a half-volley, driven down the ground, Dawlat puts the dive in to prevent any runs
wider on the crease, and bowls an inswinger. Shaping in towards the middle of the off stump. Defended back to him

beautiful over. Perfect seam and swing bowling. A few outswingers, then inswinger from wide on the crease, and ends up with a sucker punch of an outswinger. Full, just outside off, Finch thinks he can drive at it, but it is not quite as full as he expects. Which means there is time for the ball to move and take the edge through to first slip where Nawroz Mangal takes a smart low catch
gets the length right by bowling full, but concedes a wide down leg
on a length, angling in towards top of off, defended from the crease

appeal for a strangle down the leg side. Full, angling down leg, there is a sound as it passes the batsman, there is a deflection too, but just the fact that it has died through to the keeper suggests it has gone off the pad and not the bat. Replays confirm the suspicion
don't bowl short, SZ. Warner pulls this over midwicket for four. And a soft short ball. Not a mean bouncer
full this time, but too straight, and has been defended to mid-on
full, really full, Warner plays from the crease, waiting for the short ball. Defends in front of his body. To mid-off
length ball, Warner stays back to muscle a punch shot, but hits it straight to mid-off
this is fullish and widish, and has been left alone
seams away a touch, short of a length, from outside off it goes further away. Left alone
full outswinger, he moves across to push this wide of mid-off for one
nearly a wicket. Sharpish pace, a length ball, angling away, beats Warner's attempt to punch this through cover. Beats him for pace with the skid-through bounce
nearly again. This time the sucker delivery. Floated outside off, slight swing away. No feet from Warner as he drives. Beaten
outswinger, but too straight, and clipped away off the toes for three
full, angling in, gets some extra bounce, hits him on the thigh pad
full, straight and fast, defended to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, punched away, to cover-point
full, into the pads, pushed wide of mid-on for a single
leading edge as Smith goes across the stumps to work to leg. It rolls along the ground to cover
good decision by umpire Gough. Short of a length, rib-high, Smith has moved across, and the ball has gone over the fourth stump. Not called a wide
full and wide. Just inside the tram line. Warner goes after it, and is beaten. No feet
more accurate, gets some shape back in to the left-hand batsman. Squares Warner up in defence
this time he gets a shortish length with a hint of width, and he has punched this past point for three
short of a length, on around middle, but for Smith that means leg because he moves across. He has worked this around the corner and timed it superbly for three
full and outside off, pushed away from the body. Not in control as he pushes this to cover
short of a length, just outside off, defended to cover
full outswinger but starts a touch too wide, and is called too
moves across to pick this leg-stump delivery off the toes for a couple
cuts him in two. Short of a length, seams back in to pass between the bat and the body of the shuffling Smith. Shout for a catch off the inside edge but more in optimism than conviction
fuller, outside off, he moves across to push this wide of cover for one
full, really full, provides him the width too, driven wide of point for three
full, swinging in, pushed wide of mid-on for one
short of a length, outside off, punched between cover and extra cover, and they run well to complete three
oh that is crisp. Wide length ball, and he has absolutely crunched this in front of cover with a merciless drive

wide length ball, beats his edge, and is unfairly wided. That is nowhere near the tram line. A much wider ball was allowed to go through by Dharmasena. Ordinary umpiring. If these are wided, we might never see the end of this innings
short of a length, just outside off, punched away, but straight to cover
pulls from outside off, not short enough, hence this aerial stroke through mid-on. Lucky he has hit this straight of that man at mid-on
bouncer, higher than the chest, pulled in front of square
wide length ball, eases into a drive, but straight to cover
short, shouldn't be bowling that at his pace. Gets only waist high. That's meat and drink for Warner. Four through wide long-on
full and straight, dug out off the toes for one
shouldn't be bowling so short to Warner. And it is waist high again. Gets inside the delivery and pulls it over square leg
wide length ball, and Warner is laying into these now. Lofts this over mid-off. Totally crunches this
fuller and straighter, pushes this to mid-off
slower ball, Warner has adjusted superbly and lofted this full ball back over Hamid's head. This is very good batting. How will Afghanistan react to this barrage?
short of a length, just outside off, pushed towards long-off for a single that brings up his fifty. If he bats 50 overs, some records might fall
length ball, middle and leg, straightens a touch, worked to leg for one
nice drift as he tosses this up outside off. Defended to cover
this one is full, turning into the pads, worked away for a single
down the wicket, not quite to the pitch of the ball, pushes this back to Nabi who dives past Smith to field
quicker, on off, defended from the crease
flighted outside off, pushed down the ground, but Nabi fields to his right
moves across to take this length ball from off and middle, and works this to square leg for one

short again, this is chest high, but Warner has still pulled this well. More difficult to control than the earlier freebies he has got, but he has managed to roll his wrists and keep this down. Gets four through midwicket
short-arm pull to square leg for one
moves across again, misses one on off, but the bounce is carrying it over when it hits the pad
tucks him up with a shortish delivery, Warner opens the face, places it wide of point for a single
shuffles across again, works this from outside off to square leg for a single
down the wicket, takes this on a half-volley, drives it to long-on
down the wicket to chip this wide of long-off where Dawlat makes a diving save to save two runs
flatter, fired in, defended from inside the crease
tossed up this time, nearly yorks the advancing Warner, pushed to long-on
this is middle and leg, worked away for a single
tossed up outside off, punched away to deep cover
on a length, outside off, Smith can't get inside the line of this, plays this to point
takes this shortish delivery from well outside off, works it to square leg for one
slower ball, he waits for it, and punches this to extra cover
looks to pull from outside off, slightly late into the shot, hit around the midriff
full, angling in, defended back to him
full, angling in towards off, defended to mid-off
tossed up, middle and leg, defended back
flat legbreak, pushed back to him. Not much turn
a touch too short, he is lucky this has been pulled straight to midwicket
tossed up on middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
nice legbreak. Just outside off, on a good length. Defended
low full toss, driven to long-on for one
on a length, offbreak, pushed back to him
tossed up on middle, Smith charges at him, gets too close to the ball, drives it back to Nabi
on a length, turning in, worked wide of midwicket for one
slightly short, punched away straight of deep cover to take a couple
full, dipping on him, driven back at Nabi
short of a length, Warner goes back to punch this to long-on for one
full and flat, on the pads, Warner misses out. Is hit on the pad
too short, not too wide, but Warner makes his own room and cuts this away for four past point
flighted outside off, driven wide of long-off for two
full toss, dipping on him, driven with an open face to short cover
short again. Two bad balls this over. Again Warner manufactures room and cuts this in front of square for four
flighted on off, drilled down the ground, but straight to mid-off
offbreak, turns into the pads, worked to square leg. Warner's call, he wants one, and Smith is late to start. A direct hit would have had Smith, but the throw misses by inches
flighted outside off, driven to long-on
picked away off the toes for a single to deep midwicket
short of a length, just outside off, punched to deep cover
on a length, turning into the pads, pushed to long-on for one
quicker, flatter, into the pads, pushed to midwicket
full toss outside off, driven to long-off for one
on a length, not much turn, pushed to cover
tosses this legbreak up, gets some dip, Warner not quite to the pitch of the ball, pushes this to long-on
another push down the ground for a single
lovely shot. Comes down the track and makes room too, opens up the off side and drives this between mid-off and cover. All along the ground
short of a length, takes this from in front of leg, and punches this past point for one
tossed up, middle and leg, defended to midwicket
flighted, into the pads, Warner down the wicket to push this to long-on
pushed wide of Ahmadi, and Warner is in the way as he tries to field
driven to long-on for one
on a length, turning in, worked away to leg but straight to midwicket lets this offbreak turn and then pushes it down to long-on for one
full, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-off for one
wide length ball, driven to sweeper-cover for one
length ball, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
full, outside off, driven to long-off for another single
nearly a yorker outside off, dug out to cover
on a length, straightens a touch, defended to leg
slight straightening of the line from middle and leg, worked into the on side off the back foot
fired into the pads, too straight, Warner is beaten but takes the leg-bye
down the wicket, takes this on the full, pushes it to mid-off
nicely tossed up outside off. Slight dip, slight drift. Defended back
fuller, flatter, to protect the over, easy single to long-on
wide length ball, driven to deep cover for one
short of a length, outside off, Warner looks to pull it, and mis-hits it to long-on
on a length, angling in, pushed wide of midwicket for one
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man
on a length, into the pads, worked away to deep midwicket
that's an incredible shot. Moves well across the line, takes this from middle, and glances this wide of short fine leg to hit his first boundary
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
short of a length, punched to long-on for one
short of a length, provides Warner with enough time to cut this away in front of cover for a couple
tossed up on off, driven to long-off for one
stays back to punch this length ball down to long-on
flat, angling in, punched to cover
flighted outside off, driven to long-off for one
flat length-ball legbreak, defended to midwicket
full, outside leg, pushed wide of deep midwicket to come back for a couple that takes him to 99
tossed up on middle and off, drives hard, but finds short straight cover

flighted legbreak, Warner looks to open up to play to cover, the ball turns, takes the inside edge, but Warner brings up the 100 nonetheless. This is ridiculously early into the innings for a hundred. I shudder at the thought of his being not out at the end of the innings
flat and wide, he goes back to create the length and cuts it away for four
he has dragged this pull from well outside off and sent it sailing over mid-on. Warner could be thinking 300 here
fuller, angling in from round the wicket, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, angling in, opens the face, can't beat point
gets inside the line of a shortish ball and works it to square leg for one
low full toss, hit hard down the ground, but can't beat mid-on
why do they keep bowling short to him? Warner pulls this in front of square with the front leg in the air. Finds the gap between mid-on and midwicket
down the wicket, takes this from middle and leg, whips it past midwicket for four more. Low full toss too. Afghanistan need wickets. And fast
flighted outside off, nice dip on the legbreak, defended by Smith
flighted outside off, and Smith gets a thick edge on the drive
slows this down, gets dip, just outside off, defended back to him
front of the hand, quicker, flatter, driven to long-off for one
makes room to push this legbreak wide of mid-off for one
full outside off, driven to long-off for one
wide length ball, driven with an open face to deep cover
full, angling in, pushed to long-off for one
moves across to push this length ball wide of mid-off for one
really full, driven with an open face to deep cover
moves inside the line again, and tucks a shortish delivery away into the leg side
and brings Smith a gift, a short and wide delivery, which has been cut away past point. Smith brings up his fifty
flighted outside off, driven to long-on for one
well bowled, some dip there as Warner is lining him up for a hit over wide long-on. Defended to cover
flat, into the pads, tucked away for a single
slower through the air, worked away off the pads for one

has he dropped him? There is extra bounce here. Warner looks to cut. There is extra bounce. Gone past him. Dharma the umpire looks interested. Afsasr has not hung on to this. This is nearly impossible for a keeper. Quite a thick top edge. It has hit his chest and has fallen down
full, into the pads, clipped away for two
lovely on drive. On a length, middle and leg, he just meets it with a straight face, to beat mid-on to his left
full, on the pads, clipped away
Warner is in the mood now. Gentle length ball, wide outside off, he is on a knee to drop this over mid-on for a flat six. Warner's first six. Something says first of many
low full toss, and he has drilled this over long-on for another six. Warner is looking very dangerous here
no luck for Afghanistan. Slower ball, short of length, wide outside off, he still throws his bat it, gets a thick edge, which flies between point and short third man
flat offbreak, pushed to short straight midwicket
turning into the pads, worked away for a single
short, flat, pulled wide of long-on for two
goes back to punch this on the off side, but finds cover
crunched away straight to midwicket this time
shows him the reverse hit but goes back to playing the orthodox way. Nabi fires in a yorker. No luck for him. Warner's bat comes down in time

Warner has made up his mind. Anything with pace on it has to go. Half-volley to start off a new spell, Warner clears the front leg and lofts this over long-on for a six. A good crowd catch, followed by giving it some shine by rubbing it on his groin

Warner has hit a flat six over deep midwicket. Don't bowl short to him. He is going to murder them. And he has hit a kid on the forearm in the crowd. Poor behaviour around the kid. The adult with him is on the phone and the men around him are diving in front of him to catch the ball. Poor kid is blindsighted
misses the yorker by inches, gets a bit of a leading edge as he looks to work this to leg, but it doesn't carry to deep square
lovely yorker, bang on the crease, on middle and leg. Dug out
another lovely yorker. Beats the inside edge. Concedes a leg-bye
length ball, angling in, defended from the crease
offbreak, on off, clears the front leg, goes on a knee and slogs this down straight of long-on for a four that brings up his 150
driven straight to cover
low full toss, drives down to long-off for one
arm ball, outside off, opens the face, gets a single
fires in a wide down the leg side. That's the fear of Warner

low full toss, quick too, and he has just timed it down the ground for four. This looks like a single from the time it leaves the bat. Warner is thinking single too, but he has timed it exceptionally well. Beats long-on to his right
defended back to the bowler
yorker from round the wicket, driven to deep cover for one
full and straight, follows his movement away from the stumps. Cramps him up. Pushed to mid-off
full toss outside off, driven to deep cover
yorker to Warner as he makes room. Defeats his shot, but the little inside edge carries it fine for four. Unfair game this. Highest by an Aussie in WCs
this time the yorker goes wrong, and he sends this full toss sailing over square leg for a six. Now this Warner's highest ODI score
full, angling in, defended to midwicket. No room there
short of a length, outside off, steers it to third man for one
well bowled. Yorker from round the wicket. Right on the crease. Can't do much with that. Dug out to point
full and straight, hammered down to long-off for one
lovely yorker, swinging back in, beats the inside edge of the bat and the outside edge of the off stump. That's at 145ks
slower ball, wide length ball, he is off pace with the shot, and plays it to point
full and straight, just outside off, played straight to mid-off. An excellent over
high full toss, wide outside off, and he has cut this between point and cover-point for four
yorker, outside off, pushed to mid-off for one
now Smith joins in. A length ball, middle and leg, and he has extended his arms into this with a loft over mid-on. High elbow. Classic shot. Holds the pose
lovely yorker, on the crease, played back to him
drives this on the up but finds mid-off
no-ball. The main umpire has called it. So there be a free hit. Slower ball, full toss, worked to leg for one
looks for the yorker, but goes a touch too wide, and a touch short of it being a yorker. Squeezed out over point for four
good yorker, middle and leg, dug out back to him
gets lucky with a leg-side full ball. Smith has found short fine leg with this clip
good yorker again, middle and leg, dug out towards point for one
full, angling in, middle and leg, doesn't let him get under it, plays it straight to midwicket
lucky with this length ball. Warner makes room and hits this straight to long-on
nearly a yorker. Has missed out by a few centimetres I am sure. Smith has made room, and presented it an open face, and it has sprung away for four between point and cover-point
another swinging yorker, he opens the face on it, and gets a single to third man
lovely yorker, on the crease, in front of off, dug out towards mid-off
no luck going Afghanistan's way. Smith has flicked this length ball in the air, and only because he has not timed it does it fall short of deep midwicket

there won't be a triple hundred today. At least one undesirable record avoided by Afghanistan. This is bowled cross-seam, which is possibly why it has come slower on to him. Warner gets under, goes on a knee, and wants to hit a massive six. Just gets too much under it, and sends it miles into the air. It has hit a meteor or something and has come back for Nabi to take a really difficult catch at mid-on. He goes reverse cup and just about holds on to it with the ball not landing sweetly in the palms
nearly another wicket. A length ball, angling in, hits the inside half of the bat, but it doesn't carry to midwicket
gets this fine of third man for four. Low full toss as the yorker is gone wrong, and he opens the face on it
another yorker to end a successful over. A dot
low full toss, worked to leg, but straight to midwicket
oh the reverse sweep second ball. This is too much. What a confident player Maxwell is. Sends it over point for four
looks for a big slog, gets a thick inside edge for one
short, not too wide, and he wants to cut, but misses out. Gets a bye, though
low full toss, driven to long-on for one
short of a length, quick, on off, played with an open face for a single
full and straight, driven to long-on for one
he misses the yorker by half a foot, and Maxwell makes room to carve this over wide long-off for a six
slower ball, short of a length, widish, would have been called a wide had he not followed it. Gets a single to short third man
slower yorker, dipping on him, goes off the bottom edge for one
looks for the reverse shot off the fast bowler. This is a slower ball that has defeated the stroke, and has hit the pad well outside off

slower legcutter, he goes after it, and he is lucky that he has found a slow man. Hamid Hassan is at short third man, and is slow to react, and cannot dive given his frame. This is very close to being caught
tossed up on off, lovely extra-cover drive by Smith, beating cover to his left. Not a soul has moved on the field as he caresses this for a four
quick yorker outside off, beats him, concedes a bye
gets away with a wide full toss as Maxwell has hit this back to Nabi
yorker, cannot get under it, and digs this out to midwicket. At 108ks
and now he gets the yorker wrong by inches, and he has slogged this over wide long-on for six
another full toss, on the pads, and he gets inside the line and lofts this over deep square leg
full, middle and leg, clipped away for one
low full toss, driven to extra cover. A rare dot
slower ball, shortish, cut away to third man for one
a reverse loft over point. Slower ball, the field is up on the off side, he stands there with this stance reversed, and then flicks it over square off-side field
slower legcutter, Maxwell has made room, but this has still gone wide of the tram line, and cruel as it might sound, it has to be called
slower legcutter, inches inside the tram line. Lovely delivery. Maxwell can't reach it
another yorker, middle and leg, just the single to cover
another yorker, cramping him up with leg-stump line. Dug out back to him
misses the yorker, Maxwell stays back to pump this full ball through midwicket for four

this is a 140kmph bowler for crying out loud. Maxwell is expecting a wide yorker, so he turns around, gets into a reverse stance, and takes this low full toss over short third man. This is another reverse flick
bouncer, he ducks under it, and it has been deemed to be a wide for height
short ball, he bottom-edges a pull, and the misfield at square leg concedes a couple

Smith won't have a hundred. Shapoor has bowled well, has gone for a lot still, but this is good reward. Again the cross seam means it doesn't quite come on, and he is early into the drive. Straight to mid-off. Taken
dis this in, gets it chest high, fended away behind square for one
short of a length, flat, punched to long-on for one
Afghanistan have no luck. The mis-hit towards deep midwicket here as Maxwell slogs, but it has fallen short of deep midwicket
fifty with a reverse shot. Maxwell takes this from outside leg, and wrists this over point with a four. Fifty for him
full, on off, driven wide of long-off for two
Faulkner tries to reverse. This is too short to be reversing, and he is beaten. There is half a shout for lbw, but he seems to have got outside the line
outside the crease this time, not quite to its pitch, but still gets a single to long-on
yorker outside off, can't do much with it, digs it out
another streaky boundary. Wide length ball, he throws his arms at it, slices it over short third man for four
full and straight, driven to long-on for one
incredible shot. No movement of feet or the rest of the body at all. He just stands still, waits for this length ball, and flicks this over square leg for six
high full toss. Beamer. Warning too. Maxwell wants to cut this over point. Beaten
lovely yorker, middle and leg, dug out, and they take two because it has not reached long-on fast enough. No justice in this world
low full toss, pushed to long-on
Maxwell is looking for a hundred. This is his sixth six. Down the wicket to loft this length ball over wide long-on
misses a near-impossible stumping. Sees him step out and fires this at his toes. The ball is a yorker for the keeper and has also come between Maxwell's feet
really slow in the air, he is too early into the pull. Gets a single
pushed down to long-on to give Maxwell the strike
drilled wide of long-on for two
there is no switching of the stance here. He just jumps out of the crease and drops this over long-on for an effortless six. Fastest WC hundred under serious threat
that's a lovely yorker. Hassan brings out the mini chainsaw. Inswinging yorker. On the middle and leg. Dips on him too. Beats the inside edge. Possibly takes the toe on the way to the stumps
another yorker, on off, dug out for another dot
low full toss, driven to long-on for one
low full toss, Maxwell slogs, ends up hitting it straight to mid-off

short ball with mid-on and mid-off up, which is a good option, but Maxwell has managed to pull this over mid-on. Sami Shenwari gives it a spirited chase, and keeps in what looks like a definite boundary
a yorker to end the over. Just the single. Excellent over
low full toss, he has mis-hit it, but mid-off is up and he has cleared him with ease

there won't be a fastest WC hundred here. Maxwell yet to score an ODI hundred. Slower ball, half-volley, draws a sort of a mis-hit, and he ends up offering a catch to extra cover. Another excellent innings by Maxwell at the WACA, but still not a hundred for him
full and straight, pushed to long-on for one
slower ball, short, pulled away to deep square leg
nice shot. Short of a length, with third man up, and he makes room to open the face late and send it fine of short third man. Dawlat reaches 100
slower ball, full, on off, dabbed away for a single
full and straight, driven to long-on for one
quick short ball, hurries him up, hits the high part of the bat, goes for a single off the mis-hit
slower short ball, pulled away to deep midwicket. Another 400 this WC. By the way, Australia have never won a match after scoring 400
yorker, a low full toss maybe, driven to long-on for one
makes room to drive this full ball to deep extra cover for a single
full and straight again, mis-hit to long-on for a single. Another excellent over by Hamid
down the wicket to hit this powerfully and straight of long-off. They take a second as he fumbles a little at long-off
short of a length, outside off, punched down to long-off
short ball, but he has lofted it back over the bowler's head for a six. Lovely high elbow there
full and straight, but he makes room and stylishly lofts this straight of long-on for four that takes this total to the highest WC score ever
driven to long-on
short ball, down the wicket, doesn't quite time this, and he finds deep midwicket with this hit
